column2: Mine Site Infrastructure Design : Civil engineers design and plan the layout of mine sites, including roads, bridges, tunnels, and buildings. They ensure that these structures are safe, efficient, and compliant with regulations. Tailings Management : Civil engineers are involved in the design and construction of tailings dams and other structures used for the safe storage and management of mining waste. Water Management : Civil engineers design water management systems for mining operations, including drainage systems, water treatment plants, and water supply infrastructure. Geotechnical Engineering : Civil engineers assess the stability of soil and rock formations to determine safe excavation methods and design appropriate support structures for mine workings. Environmental Compliance : Civil engineers work to ensure mining operations comply with environmental regulations by designing and implementing erosion control measures, reclamation plans, and other environmental mitigation strategies. Safety Engineering : Civil engineers play a key role in ensuring the safety of mining operations by designing structures and systems to mitigate risks such as slope instability, subsidence, and ground collapse. Project Management : Civil engineers often take on project management roles in mining projects, overseeing the planning, budgeting, and execution of construction and infrastructure development. Infrastructure Maintenance : Civil engineers are responsible for the ongoing maintenance and rehabilitation of mining infrastructure to ensure its continued safety and functionality. Remote Site Engineering : Many mining operations are located in remote or challenging environments, requiring civil engineers to develop innovative solutions to logistical and infrastructure challenges. Consulting : Civil engineers may work for consulting firms that specialize in providing engineering services to the mining industry, offering expertise in areas such as feasibility studies, environmental impact assessments, and infrastructure design. These are just a few examples of the diverse range of roles that civil engineers can play in the mining sector. The industry offers opportunities for civil engineers to apply their skills in various fields and make valuable contributions to the extraction of minerals and resources.
column11: Be, Civil Engineering, Mining Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, B.Tech, Diploma

column2: Job Description: The Technical proposal preparation role is responsible for creating comprehensive and competitive technical machine tool solutions, catering to the specific needs and requirements of clients. This position plays a crucial role in the sales process, contributing to the development of customized solutions and ensuring that clients receive accurate and compelling technical information to make informed purchasing decisions. Key Responsibilities: Client Needs Assessment: Conduct in-depth study of customer requirements / specifications to understand their machine tool requirements, production processes, etc. Machine Tool Selection: Collaborate with the engineering team to select the most suitable machine tools from the product portfolio that align with the client's needs. Technical Solution Design: Develop detailed technical solutions and configurations, including machine tool specifications, features, capabilities, and optional accessories. Cost Estimation: Collaborate with costing team to prepare accurate cost estimates for the proposed machine tool solutions, including the machine itself, installation, training, and any additional services or products. Proposal Development: Create professional and persuasive technical proposals that clearly articulate the benefits and advantages of the proposed machine tool solution, addressing client needs and concerns. Technical Documentation: Compile all necessary technical documentation, schematics, and drawings to support the proposal, ensuring that it aligns with industry standards and regulations. Bid Response: Respond to client inquiries, requests for clarification, or modifications to the initial proposal in a timely and professional manner. Product Knowledge: Stay updated on the latest advancements and features of machine tools and other relevant products, ensuring a strong understanding of the product portfolio. Competitive Analysis: Keep abreast of competitors' offerings and pricing, contributing insights to the pricing strategy and ensuring the competitiveness of proposals. Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including sales, engineering, costing and project management, to ensure a seamless transition from proposal to project execution. Customer Support: Provide technical support to clients during the proposal evaluation process, addressing their queries and concerns. Qualifications and Skills: Bachelor's degree in mechanical engineering, or a related field. Strong technical knowledge of machine tools / industrial equipments and related technologies. Excellent communication and presentation skills. Preferable knowledge of using CAD software for creating technical drawings and schematics. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Attention to detail and the ability to work on multiple proposals simultaneously. Sales acumen and the ability to understand client requirements. Familiarity with industry standards, regulations, and safety protocols. Experience: 4  5 Years for Executive / Engineer post. 7 ??8 Years for Manager post.

column2: Job Description: Sr. Structural Engineer- Offshore  We are looking for Structural Engineer for a middle-  level role. To manage projects of changing scopes from feasibility study, survey, design engineering, specifications preparations, review of detailed design documents, project monitoring, site supervision. If you have a proven track record in the offshore sector, this is your chance to step up. You will be part of passionate colleagues and cultured company, which is well known for delivering quality and best services.  Position:  Structural Engineer- Offshore  Experience: between 5-10 years Position Purpose: Basic & Detail Design Engineering activities for the assigned project(s) in Petrochemical Plants, Oil & Gas Plants, Offshore Drilling Rigs, etc., in accordance with the Company, established procedures.  Preparation/review of PFD, P&IDs, project-specific specifications, design calculation/analysis, procurement specification.  Interface with other disciplines, user departments, and Clients.  Estimation/engineering work related to bids.  Role & responsibilities     As an Offshore Structure Engineer, you will be working closely with the team in order to execute Offshore engineering projects. Your responsibilities will be as follows: Carry out Pre-Service and In-Service Structural Analysis of Jackets, Topsides, and Modules Using SACS, Staadpro, Ansys, etc FEM Software and prepare a calculation report. Technical reviews of engineering consultant output where the work is subcontracted. Detailed study of loads and loading combinations used for offshore design. Jacket and Topside preservice analysis Jacket Impact Analysis Jacket and topside Fatigue Analysis Pile Drivability Analysis Topside Inplace Analysis Topside Misc Design Helideck & Building module design Preparation of MTO and WCR. Must have done at least 2-3 Detail Engineering offshore projects with Jacket/Topside Design scope of work. Good understanding of the latest API, DNV, AISC/EURO codes is a must. Should be able to do all the engineering calculations independently. Candidate should have worked in the capacity of lead engineer (for Topside/ Jacket/FPSO Modules) for at least one medium to large size project.   Essential Skills & Experience Qualification: B.E./B.Tech -Civil/Structural or M.E/MTech Structural/Offshore Structural (Preferred) Specialization in Petroleum / Petro Engineering preferred.  Non-Technical Competencies: Project Management Supervisory potential Good verbal and written communication skills Good Presentation Skills Self-Motivated Team Player Business Etiquettes Preferred Experiences  At least 5 years or more; relevant experience gained from an Offshore/Oil and Gas industry Experience multiple projects will be added advantage  Skill Set: Strong organizational skills, technical competence, and attention to detail.  Ability to provide the supporting design calculations. Must have experience in independently reviewing analysis files. Must hold strong knowledge of strength, buckling, fatigue, and dynamic behavior of structures. Candidate must hold expert-level knowledge in FEM tools. Familiarity with the following will be considered as an additional advantage; 3D environment working with software such as SP3D, TEKLA. Team leads in medium to large size relevant project Process knowledge and ability to develop a team.  Strong analytical skills and ability to produce coherent, self-explanatory reports such as technical documents, market research analysis, and business advisory. Team Player

column2: Job Description Resolves engineering problems by collecting and analyzing information; researching, analyzing, adapting, and modifying engineering techniques; recommending solutions; preparing drawings, schematics, and diagrams; evaluating components, materials, and suppliers; resolving design integration issues; developing specifications and safety standards; performing installations. column2: Job Description Email your applications to Pratyusha.g@quest-global.com Title :Geo Technical Engineer Note: Please do not disclose any customer details like name of the customer, project, product, application etc. Please include Roles & Responsibilities, Required Skills, Desired Skills Do not edit/delete Quest Global related content at the top of the JD Job Description : Quest Global is an organization at the forefront of innovation and one of the worlds fastest growing engineering services firms with deep domain knowledge and recognized  expertise in the top OEMs across seven industries. We are a twenty-five-year-old company on a journey to becoming a centenary one, driven by aspiration, hunger and humility. We are looking for humble geniuses, who believe that engineering has the potential to make the impossible, possible; innovators, who are not only inspired by technology  and innovation, but also perpetually driven to design, develop, and test as a trusted partner for Fortune 500 customers. As a team of remarkably diverse engineers, we recognize that what we are really engineering is a brighter future for us all. If you want to contribute to meaningful  work and be part of an organization that truly believes when you win, we all win, and when you fail, we all learn, then we??e eager to hear from you. The achievers and courageous challenge-crushers we seek, have the following characteristics and skills:   Roles & Responsibilities: You will be part of integrated Site Assessment and Ground Engineering team developing fit-for-purpose ground models and ground-engineering for bid assessment through design, construction, and operation. The ground models and engineering jointly developed by acquiring, interpreting, and engineering with ground data are a critical part of wind farm development. The role is fundamental to identifying the optimum locations and  engineering solutions for offshore wind developments. It requires collaboration with engineering, and construction disciplines to safely deliver site investigations, foundation design and ultimately foundation installation. The focus of the role is the geotechnical aspects of site-assessment related to the design, construction, and installation of foundations for Wind Turbine Generators (WTG) and associated infrastructure (offshore and onshore  substations, cables) in support of low carbon energy projects and operations. Be part of a specialist group providing geotechnical engineering expertise across offshore wind portfolio from bid through development to operations. Work within an integrated geoscience team integrating geotechnical data to help build fit for purpose integrated ground models for wind farm engineering. Assist quantification of (geo) hazards risk and opportunities to relevant stakeholders to ensure they are understood and controlled across the business. Provide quantitative analysis to help select offshore wind foundation concept for fixed and floating foundations with due consideration of technical feasibility, ease of construction, transportation to site, installation  challenges, risks, and life-of-field cost. Ensure safe and cost-efficient design and integrity management throughout asset life in accordance with industry technical practices and standards. Develop relationships with third party suppliers, contractors, and other partners. Actively contribute to technology development and to the wider geotechnical engineering community of practice to share knowledge and findings. Required Skills (Technical Competency):  Civil/ Geotechnical engineering degree. ??5 years or more of relevant industry experience ??Appropriate professional accreditation ??Knowledge of industry codes and standards. ??Excellent interpersonal skills both oral and written. ??Proven experience in Offshore Wind ground engineering for a wide range of ground engineering services including foundations e.g. Monopiles, suction caissons, driven piles, drilled and grouted piles, shallow foundations (inc.  Gravity base structures, and Jack-up units) and Cables e.g. burial-risk assessments, thermal response, landfall and onshore design. ??Proven experience in planning and implementation of site investigations, characterization and ground modelling, and related development of Basis??of design. Desired Skills: Masters/ PhD in relevant engineering discipline Knowledge of the variety of site-survey data types commonly used in different settings. Geotechnical Site Survey acquisition design, oversight, and QC, and/or offshore experience on site survey vessels. Advanced CPTu interpretation expertise. Data Integration (in particular of Geophysical, Geotechnical and Geological logs) expertise and familiarization with ground models. Coding/ Scripting expertise Fundamental Project Management Skills

column2: Process Design Engineering           Carry out a range of activities under the guidance of more senior colleagues to support the analysis of information, the specification of the methods, process steps, and the plant, machinery and equipment required to design and continuously improve manufacturing or materials processes and process systems.           Engineering Solutions Design       Contribute to the development of and implement feasibility testing of proposed engineering solutions to provide feedback and data to validate the design.           Engineering Standards Specification           Carry out a range of activities under the guidance of more senior colleagues to support the drafting of engineering standards and specifications and the evaluation of the effectiveness of those standards.           Engineering Inspections           Carry out inspections under the supervision of senior colleagues to evaluate the quality of engineering works and/or the integrity of existing installations or structures, and make recommendations to senior colleagues on the remedial works needed to ensure conformance with specifications and regulatory requirements.           Contract Management           Deliver required outcomes by coordinating activities of subcontractors and suppliers and acting as a primary point of contact for them while working within an established contract management plan.           Improvement/Innovation           Identify shortcomings in existing processes, systems and procedures, and use established change management programs to address them.           Request for Bid Solicitation/Proposal/Tender Response           Gather information and resources and draft and complete standardized proposals and fulfill all process requirements (in terms of deadlines, documentation, etc) in response to bid solicitations/request for proposal/tender, to create the best chance of being awarded the contract.           Knowledge Management System           Help others get the most out of knowledge management systems by offering support and advice.           Product and Solution Development           Carry out a range of product development and engineering activities. Use established systems to analyze customer needs and define and deliver products.           Project Management           Work within an established project management plan to achieve specific goals.           Personal Capability Building           Develop own capabilities by participating in assessment and development planning activities as well as formal and informal training and coaching; gain or maintain external professional accreditation where relevant to improve performance and fulfill personal potential. Maintain an understanding of relevant technology, external regulation, and industry best practices through ongoing education, attending conferences, and reading specialist media.             Behavioral Competencies               Manages Complexity           Makes sense of complex, high quantity, and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve problems. For example, looks at complex issues from multiple angles; explores issues to uncover underlying issues and root causes; sees the main consequences and implications of different options.           Collaborates           Builds partnerships and works collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives. For example, finds many ways to add value to the team; probes to draw out richer input from others; is a valued resource who goes out of the way to help others.             Skills               Engineering Technology           Works without supervision and provides technical guidance when required on how to get results using new and advanced engineering technologies.           Engineering Design           Works without supervision and provides technical guidance as needed on executing engineering designs using the appropriate methods, tools, processes and software.           Engineering Development           Works without supervision and provides technical guidance as needed on achieving engineering development targets using appropriate methods, tools, processes and software.           Business Requirements Analysis           Works without supervision and provides technical guidance when required on analyzing the business requirements that IT solutions must meet.           Engineering Specification           Works without supervision and provides technical guidance when required on producing technical engineering specifications and related materials.           Engineering Testing           Works without supervision and provides technical guidance when required on testing, evaluating and improving engineering outcomes.           Project Schedule Management           Works without supervision and provides technical guidance when required on sequencing and scheduling tasks into a project plan.           Engineering Build           Builds engineering solutions without supervision and provides technical guidance on these solutions as needed.           Engineering Implementation           Works without supervision and provides technical guidance when required on implementing engineering designs, evaluating outcomes and then making improvements as needed.           Engineering Technical Operations Support           Works without supervision and provides technical guidance when required on identifying and diagnosing operational problems, then developing engineering solutions to resolve those issues.           Negotiation           Negotiates without supervision and provides technical guidance when required on how to help the organization by obtaining consensus between two or more internal or external parties who may have different interests.           Policy and Regulation           Works without supervision and provides technical guidance when required on interpreting and applying knowledge of laws, regulations and policies in area of expertise.           Review and Reporting           Works without supervision and provides technical guidance when required on reviewing and creating relevant, lucid and effective reports.           Risk Management           Identifies, assesses, prioritizes and manages risks without supervision and provides technical guidance when required.           Costing and Budgeting           Works without supervision and provides technical guidance when required on costing, budgeting and finance tasks.           Commercial Acumen           Applies understanding of the business environment and objectives to develop solutions without supervision, while also providing technical assistance when necessary.           Requirements Elicitation and Facilitation           Works with full competence to lead facilitated sessions for requirements elicitation, focus groups, and user acceptance testing. Typically works without supervision and may provide technical guidance.           Health and Safety           Manages and applies safe systems of work without supervision and provides technical guidance when required.           Managing Change           Works without supervision and provides technical guidance when required on maintaining high performance while applying a change mindset to the planning, execution and monitoring of business activities during times of change.           Prioritizing           Works with full competence to prioritize components of a project, program, or portfolio work in context with risks, activities, stakeholders, etc across the life of the project or program. Typically works without supervision and may provide technical guidance.           Verify Requirements           Works with full competence to create the rules for requirements and design quality, perform verification activities, and maintain quality control. Typically works without supervision and may provide technical guidance.           Writing skills           Uses clear and effective writing skills without supervision and provides technical guidance when required on expressing ideas, requesting actions and formulating plans or policies.             Education             Bachelors Degree or Equivalent Level             General Experience             Experienced practitioner able to work unsupervised (13 months to 3 years)             Managerial Experience             Very limited (0 to 3 months)

column2: Looking for   Senior Civil Engineer / Head Of Department- Oil and Gas   for one of our client Location : Hyderabad   Job Description: We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Civil Engineer with over 15 years of experience in engineering design within the oil and gas industry, particularly in the UAE region. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in working with leading engineering consultancies, proficiency in ADNOC standards and international codes, and expertise in 3D modeling software such as Intergraph Smart 3D (formerly known as PDS) and Aveva E3D (formerly known as PDMS). Key Responsibilities: Engineering Design: Lead civil engineering design activities for oil and gas projects, ensuring compliance with ADNOC standards, international codes, and client specifications. Develop conceptual and detailed designs for various civil infrastructure, including foundations, structures, and utilities. 3D Modeling and Simulation: The engineer shall be familiar with PDS (Plant Design Management System)and /or SP3D software . They shall be capable to large group of Designers and 3D modelers in a multidisciplinary project. The engineer shall be experience in managing client and conducting 3D model workshops. ??Hands on experience in industry software, such as STAAD Pro, SAP, 3D Model Review Tools (SPR & NavisWorks), MathCAD, Foundation 3D, MS Office Suite, etc Project Management: Manage fast-track engineering projects from concept to completion, including planning, scheduling, and resource allocation. Coordinate with stakeholders to expedite project delivery while maintaining quality and safety standards. Site Coordination: Provide technical support during construction and commissioning phases, liaising with contractors and subcontractors to address design queries and resolve site issues promptly. Conduct site visits to monitor progress and ensure compliance with design specifications. Quality Assurance: Implement quality assurance measures to ensure the accuracy and integrity of civil engineering deliverables. Conduct regular reviews and audits to verify compliance with project requirements and industry standards. Client Engagement: Serve as a primary point of contact for clients, offering technical expertise, addressing inquiries, and providing updates on project status. Cultivate strong client relationships and identify opportunities for business development and repeat engagements. Team Leadership: Mentor and coach junior engineers, fostering their professional development and ensuring the transfer of knowledge and best practices. Lead by example, promoting a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous improvement within the team. Qualifications and Experience: Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering or a related field. Master's degree preferred. Minimum of 15 years of experience in civil engineering design within the oil and gas industry, with a focus on leading engineering consultancies and projects in the UAE. Proficiency in 3D modeling software such as Intergraph Smart 3D (PDS) and Aveva E3D (PDMS). Strong familiarity with ADNOC standards, as well as international codes and standards (e.g., ACI, AISC, BS). Proven track record of successfully managing fast-track engineering projects and delivering results within tight deadlines. Excellent communication, leadership, and interpersonal skills. Experience working in the UAE or the Middle East region is highly desirable.

column2: Power Systems Engineer : Designing, maintaining, and troubleshooting electrical power systems for buildings, plants, and infrastructure. Control Systems Engineer : Developing and implementing control systems for processes and machinery, often in manufacturing or automation settings. Electronics Engineer : Designing and testing electronic components, circuits, and systems for applications such as telecommunications, consumer electronics, and medical devices. Embedded Systems Engineer : Creating and programming embedded systems for a range of applications, including IoT devices, automotive systems, and industrial automation. Renewable Energy Engineer : Working on the design, installation, and maintenance of renewable energy systems such as solar, wind, and hydroelectric power systems. Telecommunications Engineer : Designing and optimizing telecommunications networks, including wired and wireless systems, for voice, data, and video transmission. Instrumentation Engineer : Developing and implementing systems to measure and control various parameters in industrial processes, laboratories, and research settings. Robotics Engineer : Designing, building, and programming robots for tasks ranging from manufacturing and logistics to healthcare and entertainment. column2: Job Title:  Melt Shop Manager Location : GHY (Guwahati, India) Company Overview: We have the pleasure in introducing ourselves as  Rausheena Udyog Limited, Engineering Division , being a leading Manufacturer of ISI marked casting products and NABL accredited Laboratory and RDSO (Ministry of Railways) Certified CLASS A Foundry unit in India. Rausheena Udyog Limited, Engineering Division, started operating in the year 2010. We have grown over the years to become a  key supplier of castings catering to the needs of Indian Railways , Cement Plants, Steel & Power, Mining Sector, Construction etc. Rausheena Udyog Limited, Engineering Division, started operating in the year 2010. We have grown over the years to become a key supplier of castings catering to the needs of Indian Railways, Cement Plants, Steel & Power, Mining Sector, Construction etc Job Description: We are seeking a  highly skilled and e xperienced Melt Shop Manager   with a minimum of 5-10 years  of proven  expertise in the metallurgy industry or railway sector  and  must have demonstrable working experience with Arc Furnaces. The ideal candidate will possess a  B.Tech degree in Metallurgy  or a related field along with a demonstrated track record with Arc Furnaces and managing operations within a melt shop environment. The Melt Shop Manager will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of the melt shop operations, ensuring efficiency, quality control, and adherence to safety standards. Key Responsibilities: Operational Management: Direct and manage all activities within the melt shop, including melting, refining, and casting processes. Ensure the efficient operation of equipment and machinery to meet production targets and quality standards. Team Leadership: Lead, mentor, and motivate a team of melt shop personnel, including supervisors, operators, and technicians. Foster a culture of safety, collaboration, and continuous improvement within the team. Quality Control: Implement and maintain quality control measures to ensure the production of high-quality metal products. Monitor process parameters, analyse data, and implement corrective actions as necessary to optimize product quality. Safety Compliance: Enforce strict adherence to safety protocols and regulations within the melt shop environment. Conduct regular safety inspections, identify potential hazards, and take proactive measures to mitigate risks. Production Planning: Collaborate with production planning teams to develop production schedules and resource allocation plans. Coordinate with procurement and inventory management teams to ensure the availability of raw materials and supplies. Process Optimization: Continuously evaluate and improve melt shop processes to enhance efficiency, reduce costs, and increase productivity. Identify opportunities for automation, technology upgrades, and process innovation. Maintenance and Reliability: Oversee preventive maintenance programs for melt shop equipment and machinery. Coordinate with maintenance teams to minimize downtime and ensure the reliability of critical assets. Budget Management: Develop and manage the melt shop budget, including expenses for labor, materials, maintenance, and capital investments. Monitor expenses closely and implement cost-saving initiatives where possible.

column2: Barry Wehmiller Design Group is looking for  Controls Engineerto join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     A controls engineer, also known as an automation engineer or a systems engineer, is responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining control systems for various industrial processes and equipment     The primary focus of a controls engineer is to ensure efficient and reliable operation of automated systems in industries such as manufacturing, power generation, oil and gas, automotive, and many others         The job description of a controls engineer may vary depending on the specific industry and company, but here are some common responsibilities and tasks associated with the role:         System Design: Designing control systems that meet the requirements of the project, considering factors such as safety, efficiency, reliability, and cost-effectiveness     This involves analyzing process requirements, selecting appropriate control hardware and software, and creating system architectures and specifications     Programming and Configuration: Developing control logic and programming software for programmable logic controllers (PLCs), distributed control systems (DCS), human-machine interfaces (HMIs), and other control devices     This includes configuring communication networks and protocols, implementing control algorithms, and troubleshooting software issues     System Integration: Integrating various components and subsystems of the control system, such as sensors, actuators, motors, and communication interfaces     This involves hardware installation, wiring, and ensuring proper communication and interaction between different elements of the system     Testing and Commissioning: Conducting tests and simulations to verify the functionality and performance of the control system     This includes performing system-wide tests, conducting factory acceptance tests (FAT) and site acceptance tests (SAT), and resolving any issues or bugs identified during the testing phase     Troubleshooting and Maintenance: Diagnosing and resolving control system malfunctions, equipment failures, or performance issues     This includes troubleshooting electrical and software problems, conducting root cause analysis, and implementing corrective measures to restore system functionality     Regular maintenance and calibration of control systems are also part of the responsibilities
column11: interfaces, hmi, plc, field instrumentation, root cause analysis, scada, wiring, programmable logic controller, sensors, dcs, vfd, plcs, fat, industrial automation, instrumentation, distributed control system, testing and commissioning, control engineering

Data Structuring and Organization:  Develop and implement standardized data structures and naming conventions within Windchill to facilitate efficient data retrieval and analysis. 4.  Process Optimization:  Collaborate with cross-functional teams to optimize mechanical engineering processes and workflows within Windchill, identifying areas for automation and efficiency improvement. 5.  Quality Assurance:  Perform regular audits and quality checks on mechanical master data to identify and correct errors, inconsistencies, and duplication. 6.  User Training and Support:  Provide training and support to users of the Windchill system, ensuring they understand best practices for data entry, retrieval, and utilization. 7.  Documentation:  Maintain comprehensive documentation of Windchill configurations, processes, and procedures.

column2: We are Hiring for CFD Meshing Engineer  Educational qualification:  BE/Diploma in Mechanical/Production Engineering Years of Experience:  BE with 2 to 3 years/Diploma with 5 to 6 years of relevant experience Primary Responsibilities: Geometry Cleanup:  Prepare 3D CAD geometry for meshing by removing geometric inconsistencies, repairing gaps, overlaps, holes and any other defects that may hinder mesh generation or Cause inaccuracies in simulations results. Extract fluid and solid domains based on the simulation needs. Mesh generation:  generate high quality meshes using meshing software ensuring appropriate mesh resolution, element quality and boundary layer refinement to capture flow physics accurately and efficiently. Proficiency in creating hex dominant meshes, dynamic meshes etc Mesh Quality assessment:  Evaluate mesh quality metrics such as aspect ratio, skewness, orthogonality to identify and address meshing issues that could affect simulation accuracy and convergence. Mesh Optimization:  Optimize mesh topology, density, and distribution by considering factors such as boundary layer resolution, near-wall mesh refinement and adaptive meshing strategies. Automation & Scripting : Develop automation scripts or workflows to streamline geometry cleanup, mesh generation and mesh quality assessment tasks. Collaboration : Collaborate with simulation analysts and design engineers to understand simulation requirements, address geometry/meshing challenges and deliver simulation-ready models on schedule. Documentation : Document geometry cleanup and meshing procedures, including assumptions, methodologies. Write BKM and Procedures. Mandatory Skills required to perform the job:  Proficiency in CAD software (CREO, Siemens NX, SPACECLAIM ) to defeature and cleanup complex 3D geometries Expertise in meshing software (ANSYS Meshing, ANSYS workbench meshing etc.) to generate structured and unstructured meshes. Meticulous attention to detail to identify geometric imperfections, meshing errors and mesh quality issues. Effective communication skills Time management skills to manage and prioritize multiple tasks. Desirable Skills:  Proficiency in scripting languages to automate geometry cleanup and meshing tasks. Sound knowledge of Finite volume method, understanding of fluid flow physics and boundary conditions in CFD simulations.
column11: CFD Meshing, Ansys Workbench, Spaceclaim

column2: Chief Engineer        (      Job Number:          HOT0AM62    )          Work Locations      :          Hilton Mumbai International Airport Hotel            Sahar Airport Road,         Andheri East            Mumbai        400099                    With thousands of hotels in over 100 countries and territories,  Hilton offers countless opportunities to delight.  From an open door to a welcoming smile and an exceptional experience,  we offer the millions of travellers who stay with us every year a welcome they will never forget.  In addition to our flagship brand,  Hilton Hotels & Resorts,  the family of brands includes Waldorf Astoria,  LXR,  Conrad,  Canopy,  Curio Collection,  DoubleTree,  Hilton Garden Inn,  Hampton and many others.      If you appreciate the impact global travel can have on the world,  you may be just the person we are looking for to work as a Hilton Team Member.  Because it s with Hilton where we never forget the reason we're here: to delight our guests,  Team Members,  and owners alike.          The Chief Engineer manages the maintenance and repair of the hotel buildings,  grounds and contents in a cost-effective manner,  ensuring the efficient and safe operation of all plant and equipment in line with Hilton and hotel policies and procedures.            What will I be doing?       As the Chief Engineer,  you will be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standards:       Plan and carry out a range of engineering,  management and maintenance work.        Assist the Director of Engineering (DOE) to run the Engineering department efficiently.        Plan and implement duty rosters,  carry out maintenance repairs and ensure a smooth transition of duty.        Provide back-up management for the DOE in his / her absence.        Be in charge of the Engineering store and energy saving team.        Supervise the M&E system,  equipment repair and maintenance.        Schedule staff training,  evaluate and improve employee performance.        Be responsible for hotel property maintenance and safety.        Carry out energy,  environmental protection,  fire prevention and safety management.        Make sure that routine operations of the Engineering department runs smoothly.        Carry out thorough building inspections to ensure high quality of repair and maintenance and that they meet set standards.        Inspect all equipment and ensure efficient production and technology management of equipment maintenance.        Read technical reports and check all daily reports to ensure safe and normal operations of all equipment.        Arrange work intensity effectively to ensure maximum productivity and well-balanced labour.        Implement maintenance repairs and ensure an effective maintenance program.        Keep in contact with the Banquet department to be informed of event requirements to be prepared.        Schedule periodical work reports to improve working efficiency of the Engineering department.        Plan and implement multi-skills training for staff to improve work efficiency and quality.        Carry out effective control on the purchase for Engineering stock to minimize wastage and maximize cost savings.        Read water quality reports and ensure the supply of good quality water from the water treatment system.        Coordinate with the Security department,  hold fire prevention and safety meetings and ensure the effective operation of the fire prevention system.        Monitor the energy usage,  making statistics of energy consumption,  and impose energy saving measures.        Keep in contact with local authorities to solve related problems.        Maintain efficient communications with other departments to form an effective communication net among different departments.        Make good use of materials,  minimize wastage and be environmentally friendly.                        What are we looking for?      A Chief Engineer serving Hilton Brands is always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members.  To successfully fill this role,  you should maintain the attitude,  behaviours,  skills,  and values that follow:       Undergraduate.        Proficient in English to meet business needs.        At least 10 years of experience in hotel / building services or other appropriate engineering fields.        At least 3 years in a Chief Engineer position or 5 years in an Assistant Chief Engineer position in a 5-star hotel.        Have specialized knowledge on water treatment,  hydraulics,  mechanics,  chillers,  air flows,  H. V. A. C. ,  L. V. ,  electronics,  sound,  TV,  lighting,  elevators,  boilers,  pumps,  etc.        Capable of maintenance for all hotel building services including air-conditioning,  ventilation,  refrigeration,  electrical installation,  lighting system,  plumbing system,  boiler,  laundry,  kitchen,  lift,  fire protection,  escalator,  sound system,  TV system,  etc.        Possess knowledge of the requirements of government regulations and technical rules.        Capable of following specifications for hotel services.        Possess knowledge of energy conservation.        Capable of training Engineering Team Members.            What will it be like to work for Hilton?       Hilton is the leading global hospitality company,  spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels.  For nearly a century,  Hilton has offered business and leisure travellers the finest in accommodations,  service,  amenities and value.  Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands.  Our vision to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day.  And,  our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all!                    Job      :        Engineering,  Maintenance and Facilities          Schedule      :        Full-time
column11: Water treatment, Hospitality, Technology management, Pumps, Energy conservation, Ventilation, Labour, Equipment maintenance, Refrigeration, Fire protection

column2: Mine Site Infrastructure Design : Civil engineers design and plan the layout of mine sites, including roads, bridges, tunnels, and buildings. They ensure that these structures are safe, efficient, and compliant with regulations. Tailings Management : Civil engineers are involved in the design and construction of tailings dams and other structures used for the safe storage and management of mining waste. Water Management : Civil engineers design water management systems for mining operations, including drainage systems, water treatment plants, and water supply infrastructure. Geotechnical Engineering : Civil engineers assess the stability of soil and rock formations to determine safe excavation methods and design appropriate support structures for mine workings. Environmental Compliance : Civil engineers work to ensure mining operations comply with environmental regulations by designing and implementing erosion control measures, reclamation plans, and other environmental mitigation strategies. Safety Engineering : Civil engineers play a key role in ensuring the safety of mining operations by designing structures and systems to mitigate risks such as slope instability, subsidence, and ground collapse. Project Management : Civil engineers often take on project management roles in mining projects, overseeing the planning, budgeting, and execution of construction and infrastructure development. Infrastructure Maintenance : Civil engineers are responsible for the ongoing maintenance and rehabilitation of mining infrastructure to ensure its continued safety and functionality. Remote Site Engineering : Many mining operations are located in remote or challenging environments, requiring civil engineers to develop innovative solutions to logistical and infrastructure challenges. Consulting : Civil engineers may work for consulting firms that specialize in providing engineering services to the mining industry, offering expertise in areas such as feasibility studies, environmental impact assessments, and infrastructure design. These are just a few examples of the diverse range of roles that civil engineers can play in the mining sector. The industry offers opportunities for civil engineers to apply their skills in various fields and make valuable contributions to the extraction of minerals and resources.
column11: Be, Civil Engineering, Mining Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, B.Tech, Diploma

column1: Senior Civil Engineer / Head Of Department- Oil and Gas
column2: Looking for   Senior Civil Engineer / Head Of Department- Oil and Gas   for one of our client Location : Hyderabad   Job Description: We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Civil Engineer with over 15 years of experience in engineering design within the oil and gas industry, particularly in the UAE region. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in working with leading engineering consultancies, proficiency in ADNOC standards and international codes, and expertise in 3D modeling software such as Intergraph Smart 3D (formerly known as PDS) and Aveva E3D (formerly known as PDMS). Key Responsibilities: Engineering Design: Lead civil engineering design activities for oil and gas projects, ensuring compliance with ADNOC standards, international codes, and client specifications. Develop conceptual and detailed designs for various civil infrastructure, including foundations, structures, and utilities. 3D Modeling and Simulation: The engineer shall be familiar with PDS (Plant Design Management System)and /or SP3D software . They shall be capable to large group of Designers and 3D modelers in a multidisciplinary project. The engineer shall be experience in managing client and conducting 3D model workshops. ??Hands on experience in industry software, such as STAAD Pro, SAP, 3D Model Review Tools (SPR & NavisWorks), MathCAD, Foundation 3D, MS Office Suite, etc Project Management: Manage fast-track engineering projects from concept to completion, including planning, scheduling, and resource allocation. Coordinate with stakeholders to expedite project delivery while maintaining quality and safety standards. Site Coordination: Provide technical support during construction and commissioning phases, liaising with contractors and subcontractors to address design queries and resolve site issues promptly. Conduct site visits to monitor progress and ensure compliance with design specifications. Quality Assurance: Implement quality assurance measures to ensure the accuracy and integrity of civil engineering deliverables. Conduct regular reviews and audits to verify compliance with project requirements and industry standards. Client Engagement: Serve as a primary point of contact for clients, offering technical expertise, addressing inquiries, and providing updates on project status. Cultivate strong client relationships and identify opportunities for business development and repeat engagements. Team Leadership: Mentor and coach junior engineers, fostering their professional development and ensuring the transfer of knowledge and best practices. Lead by example, promoting a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous improvement within the team. Qualifications and Experience: Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering or a related field. Master's degree preferred. Minimum of 15 years of experience in civil engineering design within the oil and gas industry, with a focus on leading engineering consultancies and projects in the UAE. Proficiency in 3D modeling software such as Intergraph Smart 3D (PDS) and Aveva E3D (PDMS). Strong familiarity with ADNOC standards, as well as international codes and standards (e.g., ACI, AISC, BS). Proven track record of successfully managing fast-track engineering projects and delivering results within tight deadlines. Excellent communication, leadership, and interpersonal skills. Experience working in the UAE or the Middle East region is highly desirable.

column2: Job Description: Sr. Structural Engineer- Offshore  We are looking for Structural Engineer for a middle-  level role. To manage projects of changing scopes from feasibility study, survey, design engineering, specifications preparations, review of detailed design documents, project monitoring, site supervision. If you have a proven track record in the offshore sector, this is your chance to step up. You will be part of passionate colleagues and cultured company, which is well known for delivering quality and best services.  Position:  Structural Engineer- Offshore  Experience: between 5-10 years Position Purpose: Basic & Detail Design Engineering activities for the assigned project(s) in Petrochemical Plants, Oil & Gas Plants, Offshore Drilling Rigs, etc., in accordance with the Company, established procedures.  Preparation/review of PFD, P&IDs, project-specific specifications, design calculation/analysis, procurement specification.  Interface with other disciplines, user departments, and Clients.  Estimation/engineering work related to bids.  Role & responsibilities     As an Offshore Structure Engineer, you will be working closely with the team in order to execute Offshore engineering projects. Your responsibilities will be as follows: Carry out Pre-Service and In-Service Structural Analysis of Jackets, Topsides, and Modules Using SACS, Staadpro, Ansys, etc FEM Software and prepare a calculation report. Technical reviews of engineering consultant output where the work is subcontracted. Detailed study of loads and loading combinations used for offshore design. Jacket and Topside preservice analysis Jacket Impact Analysis Jacket and topside Fatigue Analysis Pile Drivability Analysis Topside Inplace Analysis Topside Misc Design Helideck & Building module design Preparation of MTO and WCR. Must have done at least 2-3 Detail Engineering offshore projects with Jacket/Topside Design scope of work. Good understanding of the latest API, DNV, AISC/EURO codes is a must. Should be able to do all the engineering calculations independently. Ability to provide the supporting design calculations. Must have experience in independently reviewing analysis files. Must hold strong knowledge of strength, buckling, fatigue, and dynamic behavior of structures. Candidate must hold expert-level knowledge in FEM tools. column2: Job Description: Senior Piping Engineer If you have a proven track record from the Offshore/ oil & gas Industry, this is your chance to step up. You will be a part of a team of passionate colleagues and a company which is well known for delivering quality and good services. Role & responsibilities     Prepared Technical Standard Specification (Pipe Analysis, Critical Line List). Reviewed the Piping Stress Critical Line List for mentioned projects. Reviewed flexibility analysis (both static & dynamic (modal) of piping system (AG/UG) in CAESAR II for the lines connected to Compressors (Centrifugal & Reciprocating), Turbines, Heat Exchangers, Pressure Vessels, Reactors, Columns, Closed-Couple Equipment, Pumps and Tanks. Reviewed Static equivalent analysis of seismic, wind load, slug flow, PSV Force analysis etc. as per the load case philosophy. Reviewed Secondary Stress Calculation like Flange leakage check, WRC 107/297 check, Skirt Expansion and Trunnion Qualification Calculation. Prepared Equipment & Piping packages which fall under the purview of IBR. Carryout the WTPA (Walk through Piping Audit Piping Support Audit at Plant) and issue report against the same. Perform detailed piping stress analysis using Caesar II software for various industrial projects, ensuring compliance with relevant codes, standards, and project specifications. Review piping layouts, isometric drawings, and other design documents to identify potential design issues and propose suitable solutions. Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams including process engineers, structural engineers, and designers to ensure seamless integration of piping systems with other plant components. Provide technical guidance and support to junior engineers and drafters to ensure accurate and efficient execution of piping design and analysis tasks. Conduct feasibility studies and optimization analyses to improve the performance, reliability, and cost-effectiveness of piping systems. Prepare technical reports, calculations, and documentation to support project deliverables and facilitate project reviews with clients and stakeholders. Participate in design reviews, HAZOP studies, and other engineering reviews to identify potential risks and develop mitigation strategies. Liaise with vendors, subcontractors, and clients to resolve technical queries, clarify requirements, and ensure smooth project execution. Keep abreast of latest developments in piping engineering technologies, codes, and standards to enhance departmental capabilities and maintain industry best practices.  Conversant in Nozzle Pro. Preferred candidate profile   1. Deep understanding of CAESAR II & Nozzle Pro software. 2. Conversant of Study Equipment layout. 3. Awareness of Piping material specifications, Spring hangers Details 4. Awareness of Valve and specialty data sheets. 5. Preparation of Stress Critical line list with Appropriate System Designation  6. Understanding of equipment layouts.  7.Preparation of Stress isometrics & Stress Reports, Stress Design Basis/ Philosophy

column1: Store Keeper - Manager - Engineering - Mall developers - Thane Age 32
column2: Role & responsibilities   Candidates would be solely responsible for managing and controlling Stores for all engineering material.  This includes real-time & correct Record Keeping, Manpower Management, Material Handling, Inventory Management (In-ward & Out-ward), Accounting standards & compliances (like GST) w.r.t. material at stores, Stock reconciliation in Stores.  Candidate is expected to be well versed with material inward and outward processes.  Real time reports should be available w.r.t materials, so as related activities are always done with correct data. Inventory Management: One of the primary responsibilities of a Stores In charge is to efficiently manage the inventory of the organization. This includes keeping a record of all incoming and outgoing items, ensuring accuracy in stock levels, and maintaining proper stock replenishment processes. The In charge should regularly monitor inventory levels, identify slow-moving or obsolete items, and implement effective inventory control techniques.  Stock Planning and Procurement: The Stores In charge is responsible for planning stock requirements by analyzing sales trends, understanding customer needs, and reviewing historical data. They must collaborate with purchase departments to ensure timely procurement of goods and raw materials. The In charge must maintain a good rapport with suppliers, negotiate prices, and ensure the quality of incoming materials.  Storehouse Operations and Maintenance: Another crucial role of a Stores Incharge is to oversee the overall operations and maintenance of the storehouse. This includes organizing the layout of goods, ensuring their proper storage and handling, conducting regular stock audits, and optimizing the space to maximize storage capacity. Additionally, the Incharge should implement safety standards, provide proper equipment to staff, and maintain cleanliness and hygiene in the storehouse.  Documentation and Reporting: Accurate and timely documentation is crucial in any organization. A Stores Incharge is responsible for maintaining records related to stock receipts, issues, returns, and transfers. They must generate regular reports on various aspects such as stock levels, stock movement, and inventory valuation. These reports are vital for decision-making, identifying discrepancies, and developing strategies for efficient supply chain management.  Team Management: A Stores In charge is also responsible for managing the store staff. This involves hiring and training new personnel, providing guidance and support, conducting performance appraisals, and motivating team members to achieve their targets. Effective communication and delegation of tasks are essential to ensure smooth and efficient store operations. Preferred candidate profile   Any Graduate, Diploma in Mechanical, Electrical, Civil Engineering 3 - 6 years experience  Engineering , Retail & Real estate industry would be preferable or else any industry  Contact: Interested Candidates kindly share your resume on anishaoasishrconsultant@gmail.com Anisha Shah SG OASIS

Read more about our  Corporate Responsibility Framework. To know more about ExxonMobil in India, visit ExxonMobil India and the  Energy Factor India. Follow us on Twitter,  Facebook  and  LinkedIn. What role you will play in our team The Project Controls Engineer (PCE) implements overall project controls direction through application of systems and methods for estimate development, cost control, planning and reporting, progress measurement, schedule development/control and management of change. PCE has capability to execute the technical tasks as well as lead contractors in doing them. In addition to technical ability, a PCE should demonstrate sound communication, facilitation, and interpersonal skills. This is an office-based?position in Bengaluru, Karnataka, India. What will you do Primary Job Functions Provide overall project cost, schedule, estimating, progress measurement, and change management leadership and expertise: Manage Project Cost and Schedule throughout the project life?cycle. Fully understand the scope of the project, contractual requirements, identify the major milestones and set clear priorities for the project?team. Lead the cost and schedule estimates for various Gate reviews and participate in the preparation of Gate?packages. Mentor junior project controls engineers and ensure the technical quality and timeliness of?work. Serve as a link to the Project Services Common Skill Center organization; gain alignment for support and approval of key deliverables (i.e. Estimates Development Plans, Estimates, etc.)??evelop and maintain the Project Controls related plans and?procedures. Ensure implementation of the stewardship process identify and champion process?improvements. Participate in kick-offs and ongoing meetings with the Engineering, Procurement and Construction (EPC) contractor(s) to ensure common understanding of project controls?requirements. Participate in gathering and recording lessons learned for the?project. Serve as the budget custodian, lead financial close-out of the project and participate in other project close-out?activities. Stewards Project cost/schedule with ongoing project analysis, reporting, forecasting, budgeting and Change Management: Coordinate the collecting, analyzing, and reporting of project cost and schedule control information to ensure overall project status is assessed, potential problem areas are?identified. Analyze trends, prepare forecasts, opportunities and?vulnerabilities. Administer the project change control process and communicate implication of changes. Steward the overall Change Management process: Monitoring and appraising the performance of the Contractor(s) in the areas of cost control, progress measurement and?control. Ensure that proper and effective project control measures are executed by the?Contractor. Review and endorse the plans and procedures developed by the contractor. Ensure implementation of the same. Review and endorse progress and cost/schedule baselines and forecast prepared by?contractors. Analyze cost/schedule and progress reports and trends developed by?contractor. Review cost bases of contractor's Change Proposals / Orders Assist in developing/reviewing cost corrective actions and recovery plans and?making sure needed actions/plans are?implemented. Develop cost and schedule estimates to support opportunity assessments, Project funding, Project reviews, and ad hoc?requests. About you Skills and Qualifications: Bachelors Degree in Engineering, Engineering Technology or Construction Management from a recognized university Minimum 3 years of experience project controls focused on cost control, estimating, planning, and schedule control in Oil & Gas or Construction Industry Preferred: Experience in working in Brownfield oil and gas environment Demonstrated leadership skills Good command of English both written and spoken Strong MS Excel and presentation skills Strong influencing without authority, consulting, mentoring, analytical, and computing skills Strong interpersonal and communication skills; ability to clearly and concisely convey recommendations to management / leadership Willingness to relocate to Bengaluru Willingness and flexibility to travel internationally as per business needs Willingness to work on portfolio of small to midsize Brownfield projects. Willingness to work in shift eg: 1.30 pm to 10.30 pm IST and should be an Indian national. column2: Building on our past.  Ready for the future            Worley is a global professional services company of energy,  chemicals and resources experts headquartered in Australia.       Right now,  we re bridging two worlds as we accelerate to more sustainable energy sources,  while helping our customers provide the energy,  chemicals and resources that society needs now.       We partner with our customers to deliver projects and create value over the life of their portfolio of assets.  We solve complex problems by finding integrated data-centric solutions from the first stages of consulting and engineering to installation and commissioning,  to the last stages of decommissioning and remediation.  Join us and help drive innovation and sustainability in our projects.              Purpose          You will provide Piping Engineering services to Worley,  and its customers and may provide technical support within the Piping team.                 Responsibilities               Ensure compliance with various ASME,  API & IBR codes and standards.            Perform Pipe Stress analysis (Static & Dynamic) of Critical Piping Systems in accordance with ASME B31. 3 Code Requirements,  using CAESAR II software.            Knowledge of Stress Analysis for Compressor,  Pumps,  Air coolers piping system is preferred.            Perform flange leakage checks,  blast analysis,  transit analysis,  slug checks,  wind and seismic analysis,  AIV & FIV checks.            Design and selection of pipe supports,  springs hangers & Expansion joints.            Assign criticality rating based on pipe stress design basis and prepare critical line list.            Perform isometrics checking for critical and non-critical lines using Review model and ensure support types selected in line with stress requirements.            Coordinate with Civil/Structural & Mechanical groups to ensure loads are being effectively communicated.            Perform reinforcement evaluation at pipe supports and branch connections.            Prepare project piping support specification & Design Basis.            Evaluate Stress,  Displacement,  Forces and moments on restraints for support design and Evaluate piping loads with in allowable nozzle loads.            Review of vendor documents of equipment for conforming Nozzle Forces and Moments and Fixed and Sliding Support.            Fully conversant with Anchor study requirements.            Perform Procurement Engineering within stipulated time frame of the project.  Coordinate with vendors,  subcontractors,  third party consultants,  etc.  to ensure timely review of documents and that comments are made with required quality level.
column11: Engineering services, remediation, Piping stress analysis, Chemical, Pumps, Consulting, Piping engineering, professional services, engineering procurement, Technical support

column2: Title: Senior Engineer - Piping (Materials)  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Lead a team of engineers and designers in carrying out FEED or Proposal or Detailed Engineering work assuming entire responsibility and within budgeted man-hour and project schedules by maintaining required quality Review the ITT (Invitation to Tender) documents provided in the proposals. Prepare technical queries (TQs) to the Client. Seek scope clarification, Follow up on the tender bulletins. Preparation of Wall thickness calculation, PMS, VDS, Special item datasheets and other data sheets Prepare Piping material specification, Valve material Specification and TSR for piping components. Supervise the preparation and issue of Inquiry Requisitions to vendors. Participate in technical bid evaluations. Review vendor drawings, documents, and design calculations. Ensure vendor equipment specifications meet with client equipment specifications and within budgeted costs. Prepare TQ, TBE and Purchase requisitions Coordinate Material Take-off (MTO) activities, identify irregularities, discrepancies, and shortfalls, take corrective action as required. Oversee the set-up of the Material Management system (VPRM / ERM) incorporating the project specifications. Coordinate and incorporate the MTO from the 3D model. Update and maintain the system to incorporate the latest material requirements. Administer the preparation and issue of Purchase Requisitions for the procurement of equipment and materials. Coordinate with Procurement and provide necessary assistance to Expediting and Quality Departments. Interface with Client representatives as required for resolving any technical issues. Meet vendors representatives for Piping material, vlave and special items technical discussions and selection. ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS: Bachelor's Degree in Mechanical Engineering with a minimum of 6 years of related Petroleum / Petrochemical industry experience preferable from a background in working for EPC / Consultancy organizations of the Oil and Gas Industry. A minimum of 4 years of experience within the oil & gas industry working for EPCI Consultants / Contractors. Knowledge of relevant international codes & standards like ANSI, ASME, API, MSS, BS, ISO, NACE etc., and offshore codes & standards from various classification/international societies. Knowledge about the requirements for a Material Management activities of EPC Oil & Gas and HSE requirements. Possess supervising skills for conducting basic engineering activities in Piping design & layout, Materials & specifications, Stress & Support in 3D environment, and procurement activities. Having core competencies like the ability to adopt a dynamic, tactful problem-solving approach to tasks and demonstrate coordination, monitoring, supervisory and communication skills. Knowledge of VPRM / ERM, PMS, MTO, Interdisciplinary, and interface management. Knowledge on Material Life Cycle Management and Material Management Preferred Software Experience: VPRM OR ERM

column2: As a Principal Electrical Engineer, you will work with a global team of Manufacturing and Test Engineers to bring new products to the market. The focus of this role will be to coordinate and help implement     Manufacturing Test Development for non-implantable and implantable Medical Devices such as Patient Programmers, Rechargers, and Neurostimulator devices for Deep Brain Stimulation, Spinal Cord Stimulation, and Sacral Nerve Modulation.      Manufacturing Test Development includes collaborating with external contract manufacturing partners, strategizing, initiating, and deploying Manufacturing Test Methodologies.      For all internal development teams, this Individual will serve as a single point of contact on all Manufacturing Test considerations and will be recognized as the Manufacturing Test Champion.      Experience designing, testing, and troubleshooting analog power electronics is a plus for this role.                  Responsibilities will include but are not limited to:           Provide Technical Leadership on Manufacturing Test Development for Patient Care Devices at Contract Manufacturing facilities.     Ownership of Manufacturing Test strategy and Test Requirement Specifications for Implantables and Patient Care Devices     Interface with certified test houses to verify/certify to global regulatory standards including IEC 60601, ISO 14708-3, FCC, ETSI, etc     Provide Electrical Engineering skills to analyze, characterize, and debug new product designs including    analog and digital circuitry.       Work closely with design teams (Electrical, Firmware, Mechanical) to root cause design issues, create    test suites, characterize and ultimately verify electrical designs.       Design and execute test methods (manual and automated) to characterize electrical performance and verify adherence to Product Requirements.     Analysis of product performance using DFSS techniques     Act as a liaison with external suppliers to ensure continuity of product supply by resolving supply and quality issues.     Collaborate with a cross functional team to resolve and document issues with fielded products.     Ensure understanding of all quality policy/system items that are personally applicable. Follow all work/quality procedures to ensure quality system compliance and high-quality work.     Work under minimal supervision and ability to work with others internationally and travel globally.           Must Have: Minimum Requirements           bachelors degree in a technical discipline Electrical / Electronics / Manufacturing     Minimum of 15 years of relevant experience, or advanced degree with a minimum of 13 years relevant experience       Nice to Have             Medical Device experience     Experience working with international teams and Contract Manufacturers Globally     Experience with verification and validation of class II and class III medical devices     Experience with Design for Six Sigma     Experience with analog power electronics design and troubleshooting     Experience developing automated test benches utilizing python scripts and/or LabVIEW     Experience validating test scripts, methods and systems including IQ/OQ     Experience with Altium or OrCAD schematic capture and PCB layout tools     Experience with circuit simulation tools such as PSPICE, LTSPICE

column2: Job Summary: The Head of Design and Engineering will lead the design, development and implementation of advanced battery energy storage systems, switchgear, power/ distribution transformers, earthing and electrical substations upto 220kV.  This role involves overseeing design, engineering, and execution to ensure high performance, safety, and reliability as per the global codes and standards. Key Responsibilities: 1. *Design and Development:*    - Lead the design and engineering of battery energy storage systems ( includes battery pack, battery rack, containerised solution and electrical substations.    - Develop detailed design specifications, schematics, single line diagram , and technical standards. 2. Project Management:    - Manage all phases of projects from concept to commissioning.    - Ensure projects are completed on time, within scope, and budget. 3. Technical Leadership:    - Provide technical guidance and oversight to engineering teams.    - Ensure compliance with industry standards, safety regulations, and best practices. 4. Innovation and Improvement:    - Drive innovation in battery technology and energy storage solutions.    - Continuously improve design processes and engineering methodologies. 5. Collaboration and Communication:    - Collaborate with cross-functional teams including R&D, manufacturing, and quality assurance.    - Communicate technical information to stakeholders and clients effectively. 6. Quality Assurance:    - Ensure the highest quality standards in design and engineering outputs.    - Implement robust testing and validation processes. Qualifications: - Bachelors degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or related field; Masters degree preferred. - Minimum of 10-15 years of experience in design and engineering of energy storage systems and substations. - Proven track record of managing complex engineering projects. - Strong knowledge of electrical systems, battery technologies, and substation design. - Proficiency in CAD software and engineering tools. Skills: - Project management and leadership - Advanced technical and analytical skills - Strong problem-solving and decision-making - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills - Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment Personal Attributes: - Innovative and forward-thinking - Detail-oriented and precise - Strong leadership and mentorship qualities - Commitment to continuous learning and development Application Process: Interested candidates should submit their resume and cover letter to  hr@ogoenergy.com

column2: Burns & McDonnell India has exciting opportunities for Principal Electrical Engineers interested in growing their careers in one of the most fast paced, innovative companies for high tech building design and construction. Burns & McDonnell India is establishing a team focused on mission-critical datacenter projects! This opportunity hires directly into that team and into an industry of more than $17 billion. The Mumbai office is growing a full complement of professionals with expertise in in Architecture, Mechanical engineering, Electrical engineering, Construction, and Project Management. Data Centers are an aggressive market for Burns McDonnell. Burns & McDonnell India is looking for an experienced and energetic candidate to join our Global Facilities Group in Mumbai office to lead and support electrical design activities involved on Aviation and Fueling, mission-critical datacenter, Food and Consumer, Manufacturing projects mainly in USA. This position requires an experienced electrical engineer capable of successfully solving difficult problems that require adaptation and modification of standard techniques, procedures and criteria. This candidate will lead design, planning and client coordination activities associated with high, medium and low voltage electrical distribution and control systems found in mission critical, healthcare, and industrial sites . Responsibilities: The Principal electrical engineer will manage team of designers and engineers to create world class design on a variety of projects from concept design through completion of construction. Project focus would be data centers and telecommunications facilities but could include a variety of other facilities including pharmaceutical, biotechnology, healthcare, manufacturing, airports, or institutional facilities in the US. Specific areas of responsibility include the following: 1. Designs electrical systems/equipment to provide a useful and safe environment for the mission critical market in accordance with the clients??requirements for reliability and uptime. 2. Advises clients regarding electrical systems/requirements available to meet their needs and comply with all applicable codes. 3. Review the drawing in terms of design and installation of equipment/systems to ensure compliance with design documents ?4. Conducts fault studies and load flow analysis. Develop design criteria for protective device coordination, relay applications, medium voltage transformers, switchgear, medium and low voltage distribution. 5. Able to develop and/or lead the design of electrical master plans for facilities encompassing but not limited to the following: reliable power distribution, motor control centers, energy efficient lighting systems, communications and telecom routing, instrumentation and controls for HVAC systems, fire-alarm interface, building level uninterrupted power systems (UPS) systems, engine generators. 6. Reviews electrical designs and specifications of equipment or systems being purchased or fabricated. 7. Provides electrical design direction and resource management on multi-discipline projects 8. Developing concept studies, designs, and narratives. 9. Develop, guide, and coordinate design workflows, processes, and procedures. 10. Build relationships and coordinate with Section and Department Managers as well as Project Managers in other global practices and other office locations. 11. Participate in the Identification, recruiting and management of resources to meet the needs of the business 12. All other duties as assigned  - 1. Certifications / Skills: a. Possess knowledge of all applicable standards and codes b. AutoCAD, BIM (Revit), ETAP/SKM and Strong computer skills necessary to accomplish electrical designs. c. Strong written and verbal communication skills. 2. Minimum Education: a. Bachelor of Electrical Engineering from a recognized institute. 3. Minimum Experience: a. 10 years of experience in the design, installation and maintenance of electrical distribution systems. b. A working knowledge of control systems and fundamental communication interfaces c. Demonstrated abilities as a project lead d. Industrial, Chemical & Petrochemical and Data center or telecommunication facility experience e. Knowledge of critical facility design and infrastructure
