column2: About the company? At the helm of Energy Transition, Tractebel provides a full range of services throughout the life cycle of its client's projects. As one of the world's leading Design Engineering and Advisory companies and with more than 160 years of global experience & with more than three decades in India, we are able to offer our customers multidisciplinary solutions in energy, water, and infrastructure. Job Title: SP3D Electrical Designer Job Description: Job Overview:  As an  SP3D Electrical Designer , you will be responsible for  designing and modelling electrical systems  within industrial facilities using the  SmartPlant 3D software . Your role will involve collaborating with engineering teams to ensure that electrical systems meet project specifications, industry standards, and safety regulations. Key Responsibilities: Electrical System Design:  Create detailed 3D models and 2D drawings of electrical systems, including power distribution, lighting, control panels, and instrumentation using SP3D. Collaboration: Work closely with multidisciplinary engineering teams, including civil, mechanical, and instrumentation designers, to ensure the integration of electrical systems into the overall facility design. Compliance: Ensure that electrical designs comply with relevant industry standards and local electrical codes and adhere to safety regulations. Schematic Diagrams: Develop electrical schematics, single-line diagrams, and wiring diagrams to facilitate installation and maintenance. Material and Equipment Selection: Assist in the selection of electrical components, materials, and equipment required for the project, considering cost, availability, and project requirements. Coordination: Coordinate with project managers to meet project timelines, budgets, and client expectations. Documentation: Maintain and update project documentation, records, and reports related to electrical design. raining and Support: Provide guidance and training to junior designers and technicians, as needed. Qualifications: ITI / Diploma in electrical engineering or a related field. Proficiency in SP3D and other relevant software tools for electrical design. Knowledge of electrical design principles, codes, and standards. Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Good communication and collaboration skills. Prior experience in the design of electrical systems for industrial facilities is a plus. Working Environment: SP3D Electrical Designers  typically work in office settings but may also spend time in the field, particularly during construction or project installation phases. They may work for engineering firms, construction companies, or companies in industries such as oil and gas, power generation, and petrochemicals. Regards,  Amit Singh  amitkumar.singh@tractebel.engie.com II 9810114399 II tractebel-engie.com  TRACTEBEL ENGINEERING PVT. LTD. Intec House, 37 II Institutional Area, Sector 44 II Gurgaon - 122002, Haryana, India

column2: Senior Design Manager - Solar PV (Head of Design & Engineering) Location: Hyderabad Job Type: Full-time Budget: 14LPA-20LPA About the Role: ILIOS Power is seeking a highly motivated and experienced Senior Design Manager to lead our Design & Engineering department. In this critical role, you will oversee all aspects of solar photovoltaic (PV) power plant design, ensuring projects meet technical specifications, budget constraints, and industry best practices. You will be responsible for a team of engineers and designers, providing guidance and mentorship while fostering a collaborative and innovative work environment. Responsibilities: Lead the Design & Engineering department, providing strategic direction and ensuring efficient operations. Manage all aspects of solar PV power plant design, from site assessment and feasibility studies to detailed engineering drawings, BOM and system specifications. Oversee the activities of the design team, including supervising engineers and designers, assigning tasks, and monitoring progress. Ensure all projects comply with relevant codes, standards, and regulations. Collaborate with other departments such as Project Management, Procurement, and Operations to ensure project success. Manage project budgets and ensure designs are cost-effective. Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in solar PV technology and design best practices. Develop and implement quality control procedures to ensure the accuracy and completeness of design documents. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, or a related field. Minimum 10-15 years of experience in solar PV power plant design and engineering. Proven track record of leading and managing a team of engineers and designers. Strong understanding of solar PV technology, including system design principles, components, and electrical codes for systems upto 220 KV.  Experience with solar PV design software (e.g., PVsyst, AutoCAD, etc ). Excellent project management, communication, and interpersonal skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Preferred Qualifications: Master's degree in a relevant field. Experience with Rooftop, BESS & Hybrid systems. Experience with utility-scale solar PV power plants. Experience with international solar PV projects. Experience with Design of Switchyard & Bay upto 220 KV.  Why Join ILIOS Power? Be part of a growing and dynamic company at the forefront of the renewable energy revolution. Make a real difference in the fight against climate change. Work with a talented and passionate team. Opportunity for professional growth and development.

column2: Machinery Operation: Operating and monitoring the ship's machinery and propulsion systems, including engines, boilers, pumps, and generators     Maintenance and Repair: Conducting routine maintenance, inspections, and repairs of mechanical and electrical equipment to ensure their proper functioning     Watchkeeping: Standing watch to ensure continuous operation of the ship's machinery and systems, including monitoring gauges, alarms, and control panels     Engine Room Management: Assisting in the management of the engine room, including overseeing the work of engine room crew members and delegating tasks as needed     Fuel and Lubrication: Monitoring and managing fuel consumption, as well as handling and storing lubricants and other engine room supplies     Safety and Environmental Compliance: Ensuring compliance with safety procedures, environmental regulations, and pollution prevention measures in the engine room     Emergency Response: Being prepared to respond to emergencies, including fire, equipment failures, or other critical situations, and taking appropriate actions to mitigate risks     Record Keeping: Maintaining accurate records and logs of engine room operations, maintenance activities, and equipment performance     Communication: Collaborating with other ship officers, engineers, and crew members to coordinate engine room activities and report any issues or incidents

column2: Barry Wehmiller Design Group is looking for  Controls Engineerto join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     A controls engineer, also known as an automation engineer or a systems engineer, is responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining control systems for various industrial processes and equipment     The primary focus of a controls engineer is to ensure efficient and reliable operation of automated systems in industries such as manufacturing, power generation, oil and gas, automotive, and many others         The job description of a controls engineer may vary depending on the specific industry and company, but here are some common responsibilities and tasks associated with the role:         System Design: Designing control systems that meet the requirements of the project, considering factors such as safety, efficiency, reliability, and cost-effectiveness     This involves analyzing process requirements, selecting appropriate control hardware and software, and creating system architectures and specifications     Programming and Configuration: Developing control logic and programming software for programmable logic controllers (PLCs), distributed control systems (DCS), human-machine interfaces (HMIs), and other control devices     This includes configuring communication networks and protocols, implementing control algorithms, and troubleshooting software issues     System Integration: Integrating various components and subsystems of the control system, such as sensors, actuators, motors, and communication interfaces     This involves hardware installation, wiring, and ensuring proper communication and interaction between different elements of the system     Testing and Commissioning: Conducting tests and simulations to verify the functionality and performance of the control system     This includes performing system-wide tests, conducting factory acceptance tests (FAT) and site acceptance tests (SAT), and resolving any issues or bugs identified during the testing phase     Troubleshooting and Maintenance: Diagnosing and resolving control system malfunctions, equipment failures, or performance issues     This includes troubleshooting electrical and software problems, conducting root cause analysis, and implementing corrective measures to restore system functionality     Regular maintenance and calibration of control systems are also part of the responsibilities
column11: interfaces, hmi, plc, field instrumentation, root cause analysis, scada, wiring, programmable logic controller, sensors, dcs, vfd, plcs, fat, industrial automation, instrumentation, distributed control system, testing and commissioning, control engineering

column1: Store Keeper - Manager - Engineering - Mall developers - Thane Age 32
column2: Role & responsibilities   Candidates would be solely responsible for managing and controlling Stores for all engineering material.  This includes real-time & correct Record Keeping, Manpower Management, Material Handling, Inventory Management (In-ward & Out-ward), Accounting standards & compliances (like GST) w.r.t. material at stores, Stock reconciliation in Stores.  Candidate is expected to be well versed with material inward and outward processes.  Real time reports should be available w.r.t materials, so as related activities are always done with correct data. Inventory Management: One of the primary responsibilities of a Stores In charge is to efficiently manage the inventory of the organization. This includes keeping a record of all incoming and outgoing items, ensuring accuracy in stock levels, and maintaining proper stock replenishment processes. The In charge should regularly monitor inventory levels, identify slow-moving or obsolete items, and implement effective inventory control techniques.  Stock Planning and Procurement: The Stores In charge is responsible for planning stock requirements by analyzing sales trends, understanding customer needs, and reviewing historical data. They must collaborate with purchase departments to ensure timely procurement of goods and raw materials. The In charge must maintain a good rapport with suppliers, negotiate prices, and ensure the quality of incoming materials.  Storehouse Operations and Maintenance: Another crucial role of a Stores Incharge is to oversee the overall operations and maintenance of the storehouse. This includes organizing the layout of goods, ensuring their proper storage and handling, conducting regular stock audits, and optimizing the space to maximize storage capacity. Additionally, the Incharge should implement safety standards, provide proper equipment to staff, and maintain cleanliness and hygiene in the storehouse.  Documentation and Reporting: Accurate and timely documentation is crucial in any organization. A Stores Incharge is responsible for maintaining records related to stock receipts, issues, returns, and transfers. They must generate regular reports on various aspects such as stock levels, stock movement, and inventory valuation. These reports are vital for decision-making, identifying discrepancies, and developing strategies for efficient supply chain management.  Team Management: A Stores In charge is also responsible for managing the store staff. This involves hiring and training new personnel, providing guidance and support, conducting performance appraisals, and motivating team members to achieve their targets. Effective communication and delegation of tasks are essential to ensure smooth and efficient store operations. Preferred candidate profile   Any Graduate, Diploma in Mechanical, Electrical, Civil Engineering 3 - 6 years experience  Engineering , Retail & Real estate industry would be preferable or else any industry  Contact: Interested Candidates kindly share your resume on anishaoasishrconsultant@gmail.com Anisha Shah SG OASIS

column2: Thermal Management System Design Thermal management design for Lithium-ion Batteries (LiBs ) is critical to maintaining their performance, safety, and longevity in electric vehicles (EVs).   To address key aspects LiBs, we can enhance the safety,reliability, performance, and service life of their battery packs, contributing to the overall success and adoption of electric vehicles. REQUIRED CANDIDATES PROFILE ??BE ME/  in Electrical/Mechanical/Chemical/Energy Systems, or a related field. ??Specialization or coursework in battery technologies, thermal management systems, heat transfer, and energy storage systems. ??M inimum 8 yrs of core experience in design, and validation of lithium ion battery pack thermal management system with proven success working with all types of Li-B chemistry. ??In-depth understanding of Lithium-ion battery chemistries, characteristics, aging mechanisms, and thermal behaviour. ??Knowledge of battery pack construction, materials selection, insulation techniques, and thermal interface materials (TIMs). ??Proficiency in thermal management principles, heat transfer mechanisms, and thermal analysis techniques. ??Familiarity with  Battery Management Systems (BMS), temperature sensing technologies (thermistors, thermocouples), and thermal modelling software (e.g., ANSYS Fluent, COMSOL Multiphysics). ??Expertise in designing and implementing battery cooling systems, such as liquid cooling, air cooling, or phase-change material (PCM) cooling. ??Understanding of coolant circulation loops, heat exchangers, pumps, radiators, fans, and thermal management components. ??Proficient in conducting thermal analysis, simulations, and modeling of battery packs using software tools like Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD), Finite Element Analysis (FEA), or equivalent. ??Ability to analyse heat dissipation rates, temperature profiles, thermal gradients, and airflow within battery packs under different operating conditions. ??Knowledge of safety standards, regulatory requirements, and industry guidelines related to battery thermal management (e.g., UN 38.3, ISO 26262, SAE J2464). ??Experience in implementing safety features, thermal protection mechanisms, and emergency shutdown protocols in battery systems. ??Experience in planning, conducting, and analyzing thermal tests, including temperature cycling tests, thermal shock tests, accelerated aging tests, and abuse tests. ??Ability to interpret test data, identify performance trends, troubleshoot thermal issues, and recommend design improvements. ??Proactive attitude towards staying updated with emerging technologies, advancements in battery thermal management, industry trends, and best practices. ??Ability to innovate, propose new solutions, and optimize thermal management designs for improved efficiency, reliability, and performance. ??Excellent communication skills (verbal, written, and interpersonal) to convey technical concepts, present findings, and collaborate effectively with stakeholders. ??Proficiency in preparing technical documentation, reports, design specifications, and compliance documentation for internal review and regulatory approval. if you meeet the job requirement criteria feel free to call or share cv contact 934162685
column11: Lithium Ion Battery, battery management system, BMS, Thermal Management

column2: Building on our past.  Ready for the future                Worley is a global professional services company of energy,  chemicals and resources experts.  We partner with customers to deliver projects and create value over the life of their assets.  We re bridging two worlds,  moving towards more sustainable energy sources,  while helping to provide the energy,  chemicals and resources needed now.                 We partner with our customers to deliver projects and create value over the life of their portfolio of assets.  We solve complex problems by finding integrated data-centric solutions from the first stages of consulting and engineering to installation and commissioning,  to the last stages of decommissioning and remediation.  Join us and help drive innovation and sustainability in our projects.                    Purpose                    You will provide Civil Structural Engineering services to Worley,  and its customers and may provide technical support within the Civil Structural team.  As Structural Engineer you will undertake specific design tasks relating to offshore structural engineering analysis and design Specific Accountabilities                Responsibilities                                        To produce structural/system models on Sesam GeniE,  FEMAP,  STAAD-Pro,  and SACS.  Also,  should have fair knowledge in developing the local calculations using spreadsheets/Mathcad etc.               Knowledge of writing Java scripts for Sesam GeniE is preferred.               Structural analysis for New platform/ platform modification.                Manage structural engineering design and any design changes within budget and schedule.                Promote cost reduction and productivity enhancing initiatives.                Technical supervision of project designated structural designers and draftsmen in the execution of their duties.                Benchmark structural design/drafting to identify areas of improvements. column2: Job Description Email your applications to Pratyusha.g@quest-global.com Title :Geo Technical Engineer Note: Please do not disclose any customer details like name of the customer, project, product, application etc. Please include Roles & Responsibilities, Required Skills, Desired Skills Do not edit/delete Quest Global related content at the top of the JD Job Description : Quest Global is an organization at the forefront of innovation and one of the worlds fastest growing engineering services firms with deep domain knowledge and recognized  expertise in the top OEMs across seven industries. We are a twenty-five-year-old company on a journey to becoming a centenary one, driven by aspiration, hunger and humility. We are looking for humble geniuses, who believe that engineering has the potential to make the impossible, possible; innovators, who are not only inspired by technology  and innovation, but also perpetually driven to design, develop, and test as a trusted partner for Fortune 500 customers. As a team of remarkably diverse engineers, we recognize that what we are really engineering is a brighter future for us all. If you want to contribute to meaningful  work and be part of an organization that truly believes when you win, we all win, and when you fail, we all learn, then we??e eager to hear from you. The achievers and courageous challenge-crushers we seek, have the following characteristics and skills:   Roles & Responsibilities: You will be part of integrated Site Assessment and Ground Engineering team developing fit-for-purpose ground models and ground-engineering for bid assessment through design, construction, and operation. The ground models and engineering jointly developed by acquiring, interpreting, and engineering with ground data are a critical part of wind farm development. The role is fundamental to identifying the optimum locations and  engineering solutions for offshore wind developments. It requires collaboration with engineering, and construction disciplines to safely deliver site investigations, foundation design and ultimately foundation installation. The focus of the role is the geotechnical aspects of site-assessment related to the design, construction, and installation of foundations for Wind Turbine Generators (WTG) and associated infrastructure (offshore and onshore  substations, cables) in support of low carbon energy projects and operations. Be part of a specialist group providing geotechnical engineering expertise across offshore wind portfolio from bid through development to operations. Work within an integrated geoscience team integrating geotechnical data to help build fit for purpose integrated ground models for wind farm engineering. Assist quantification of (geo) hazards risk and opportunities to relevant stakeholders to ensure they are understood and controlled across the business. Provide quantitative analysis to help select offshore wind foundation concept for fixed and floating foundations with due consideration of technical feasibility, ease of construction, transportation to site, installation  challenges, risks, and life-of-field cost. Ensure safe and cost-efficient design and integrity management throughout asset life in accordance with industry technical practices and standards. Develop relationships with third party suppliers, contractors, and other partners. Actively contribute to technology development and to the wider geotechnical engineering community of practice to share knowledge and findings. Required Skills (Technical Competency):  Civil/ Geotechnical engineering degree. ??5 years or more of relevant industry experience ??Appropriate professional accreditation ??Knowledge of industry codes and standards. ??Excellent interpersonal skills both oral and written. ??Proven experience in Offshore Wind ground engineering for a wide range of ground engineering services including foundations e.g. Monopiles, suction caissons, driven piles, drilled and grouted piles, shallow foundations (inc.  Gravity base structures, and Jack-up units) and Cables e.g. burial-risk assessments, thermal response, landfall and onshore design. ??Proven experience in planning and implementation of site investigations, characterization and ground modelling, and related development of Basis??of design. Desired Skills: Masters/ PhD in relevant engineering discipline Knowledge of the variety of site-survey data types commonly used in different settings. Geotechnical Site Survey acquisition design, oversight, and QC, and/or offshore experience on site survey vessels. Advanced CPTu interpretation expertise. Data Integration (in particular of Geophysical, Geotechnical and Geological logs) expertise and familiarization with ground models. Coding/ Scripting expertise Fundamental Project Management Skills

column2: About CoinDCX At CoinDCX, we are on a mission to lead the change toward a decentralised world, and we believe our employees are at the heart of it. Our journey over the past five years has been exhilarating as we have made significant strides - from becoming a unicorn to being a compliant exchange, onboarding over 15 million users, to launching an innovative self-custodial DeFi app called Okto. We are backed by investors such as Pantera, B Capital Group, Bain Capital Ventures, and Coinbase Ventures, among others. Building on this momentum, our focus now is on developing cutting-edge products, addressing accessibility and security challenges, and bridging the gap between people and Web3 technologies. Join us at CoinDCX, where CHANGE STARTS TOGETHER, and be part of an exciting journey to shape the future of the Web3 space. We offer a dynamic and inclusive work environment, ample opportunities for professional growth, and the chance to make a meaningful impact in the crypto and Web3 ecosystem. The Web 3 space is still new and were just getting started!? Inside CoinDCXs Engineering Team Our engineering team is an awesome group of collaborative people, who love to solve this first-of-its-kind problem with a lot of passion and creativity. When you join this team you work with dynamic and fun-loving engineers at the top of their game. You??l contribute to implementing innovative technology to revolutionize the crypto ecosystem. Love what you just read and are upbeat about it already? Then, this is the place for you. Who you are   Engineers with a result-oriented impact-driven mindset.? Engineers with a bias towards action and believe in leading by example Engineers who can adapt to our needs for CoinDCX?? rapid growth and support the fast-growing/changing business environment. Engineers who have the willingness to learn new technologies on the job to solve problems related to scalability and performance. Engineers who can help foster a culture of transparency, efficiency, and accountability through their passion and commitment to work. Engineers with a passion for Web 3.0 technologies. Collaborate with product and design to move fast on creating solutions. Own and create intuitive, fluent, and responsive user interfaces. Build fast-rendering reusable and extendable mobile app components. Help build a team and cultivate innovation by driving cross-collaboration and execution of projects across multiple teams. Mentor and train other team members on design techniques, and coding standards. What you'll bring? 3+ years of experience in building scalable applications on Android or iOS (We build our apps using Flutter but are happy to talk even if you haven?? worked on Flutter) Experience developing mobile apps using Kotlin, Java, Swift or C/C++ Solid understanding of mobile application development and architectures on Android or iOS Strong state management knowledge Ability and willingness to learn Flutter and app development using Dart. Excellent verbal and writing skills; ability to produce clear, concise communications and documentation. Experience and/or willingness to work in high-functioning agile teams in a growth-oriented environment. column2: About the Company:  We are an industry leading 31-year-old family-owned company headquartered in Punjab, that is in the business of manufacturing rubber hoses and metal auto-retractable hose reels. We are the largest manufacturing exporter of general purpose hoses and reels from India, selling in over 22 countries from Americas region, APAC region and multiple countries in the EMEA region. We are set to be a $100 Million company by 2026. The company has been growing multifolds and expanding its footprint across various countries. The team has been growing too with great professionals coming from diverse backgrounds (Operations, Marketing, Sales, HR, etc.) and top institutions (like IIM, XLRI). Job Location : Jalandhar, Punjab Job Summary: We are seeking an experienced and detail-oriented Mixing Manager with a strong background in rubber mixing. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in managing the rubber mixing process, ensuring quality and efficiency in production. This role involves overseeing the entire mixing operation, managing a team, and collaborating with other departments to meet production goals and maintain high standards of quality. Key Responsibilities: Leadership:  Manage and lead the rubber mixing team, providing guidance, support, and feedback to ensure high performance and professional growth. Process Management:  Oversee the rubber mixing process, ensuring adherence to specifications, quality standards, and safety regulations. Quality Control:  Monitor the quality of mixed rubber compounds, conducting tests and inspections to ensure compliance with industry standards and client specifications. Equipment Management:  Ensure proper maintenance and operation of mixing equipment, troubleshooting issues and coordinating repairs as needed. Team Collaboration:  Work closely with the production, quality control, and R&D teams to optimize mixing processes and address any issues that arise. Continuous Improvement:  Implement process improvements to enhance efficiency, reduce waste, and improve the quality of rubber compounds. Documentation:  Maintain accurate records of mixing operations, including batch records, quality control reports, and inventory logs. Safety Compliance:  Ensure all mixing operations comply with safety regulations and company policies, promoting a safe working environment. Qualifications: Experience:  6-7 years of professional experience in rubber mixing, with a strong understanding of mixing techniques, equipment, and materials. Education:  Bachelor's degree in Chemical Engineering, Material Science, or a related field; relevant certifications are a plus. Skills: In-depth knowledge of rubber mixing processes, equipment, and quality control methods. Strong problem-solving and analytical skills. Excellent organizational and project management abilities. Effective communication and leadership skills.
column11: Excel, Rubber Compounding, rubber mixing, Rubber Testing, Quality Standards, testing and analysis

column2: The Director of Software Engineering will be based in Chennai, India and lead Veryon into a new wave of automated testing leveraging leading edge development and AI tools.  They will be responsible for ensuring that all technology deliverables are produced using repeatable processes and standardized technologies which ensure quality, security, and stability.  This role will lead a Quality Engineering team growing and evolving the quality process by injecting development mindset and talent.  They will solve problems and innovate by orchestrating the correct balance of people, process and technology. Finally, the Director of Software Engineering will be a critical senior role at Veryons Chennai office.  They will need to support staff at the location providing mentoring and problem solving skills across all departments.  This role will lead teams at both Chennai, India and Colombo, Sri Lanka locations. Qualifications: Experience leading a software development and/or QA automation team Proven track record of taking ownership of change and leading cross-functional teams Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with experience building presentations and reports and presenting to senior leadership and large audiences Hands-on development and/or QA automation technical experience  What Youll Accomplish - Your Performance Objectives Objective #1 Within your first 30 days, gain a solid understanding of the current state of the team, the technology, the projects, and an idea of a growth path forward  Demonstrate a clear understanding of the existing SDLC process at Veryon Build hands-on experience with Veryon?? tools and technologies Gain an understanding and appreciation for all of the individuals influencing success of this role, including direct reports, peers and project stakeholders across India, Sri Lanka, UK and North America geographies Build recommendations in terms of growing and supporting the workplace environment and culture at the Chennai location Familiarize yourself with the Veryon Tracking+ products, being able to click through and demo the applications Objective #2 Within your first 90 days, demonstrate your ability to take in-depth understanding and create actionable plans of action. Leveraging group and one on one settings, strategize on appropriate growth plans for individuals and the team as a whole, setting appropriate targets and tracking progress Present a readout to senior leaders on a plan to evolve the Asia Quality team with clearly defined milestones and regular progress reporting Build relationships with all Chennai and Sri Lanka staff across all departments, exhibiting a leadership presence as a go to person for all senior leadership support in Asia Lead and execute day to day operations of quality teams in Asia and work with other on improving product quality by imposing a more consistent quality standard Evaluate usage of existing and potentially new technologies, ensuring that the quality team is optimized with the appropriate tooling that makes a direct impact to efficiency and effectiveness Propose and implement means to optimize productivity and improve team morale Objective #3 Within your first 6 months, establish yourself as a senior technology leader.   Demonstrate successful tracking against plan to evolve the Asia Quality team closing out milestones on time and achieving desired outcomes Maintain or improve high standard of employee engagement in the Veryon Asia Quality team Implement at least two process improvements and tracking their improvement to KPIs Implement key cultural attributes in Asia which align with Veryon?? core values, and practice communicating them as well as recognizing those who embody these attributes  Clearly articulate the cost and time savings associated with advancements in Asia?? QA Automation practice, and illustrate initiatives that the team was able to accomplish with this efficiency  Create and maintain key KPIs which can be easily consumed across the organization Build strong relationships with engineering senior leadership team and key stakeholders across the organization Who We??e Looking For ??The Personal Competencies That Matter  Influencing and relationship building:  You know you can?? do it yourself. You have the communication skills and emotional intelligence to quickly establish credibility with and gain the trust and respect of everyone in the organization. You must be able to balance asking the right questions with ensuring the deliverables of peers are not impacted.     Proactive:  You have no problem planning the work, working the plan, and proactively communicating your progress along the way. You anticipate risks and issues that will arise and mostly mitigate them independently.    Kind, humble, and fun:  We want you to be a person we enjoy collaborating with, spending time with, and investing in. You may be this person if you already invest heavily in those you work with, and if you consistently receive the feedback that you are a great colleague and teammate. A great sign is if people go out of their way to work with you, no matter the situation.    Strategic thinking/visioning : Able to see and communicate the big picture in an inspiring way. Determines opportunities and threats through comprehensive analysis of current and future trends.    Ability to coach and develop people : Coaches people in their current roles to improve performance and prepares them for future roles.    Communication : Speaks and writes clearly and articulately with executive presence. Maintains this standard in all forms of written communication, including email.  How We Work ??The Core Values That We Live By  Fueled By Customers:  We work hard so our customers can get more uptime. A customer-centered approach is on the forefront of our minds. We??e big on transparent communication with our customers, and we celebrate their wins internally because we love the positive impact we??e making on their lives. Win Together:  We focus on the ??e??and not the ??e?? Collaboration is key, we value diverse backgrounds and skill sets. Our mission is to win as a team, we think everyone plays an integral part in our success. Make it Happen:  When we make a commitment, we get it done. We take a proactive approach, we commit, we adapt to evolving landscapes and problems, we tackle problems at every difficulty level. Innovate to Elevate:  We set the standard in aviation by embracing and advancing cutting edge technology. We take a fail-forward approach using everything as a learning experience. We encourage creativity and experimentation within our teams. This helps us set the bar high and provide world class expertise in aviation.

column2: Power Systems Engineer : Designing, maintaining, and troubleshooting electrical power systems for buildings, plants, and infrastructure. Control Systems Engineer : Developing and implementing control systems for processes and machinery, often in manufacturing or automation settings. Electronics Engineer : Designing and testing electronic components, circuits, and systems for applications such as telecommunications, consumer electronics, and medical devices. Embedded Systems Engineer : Creating and programming embedded systems for a range of applications, including IoT devices, automotive systems, and industrial automation. Renewable Energy Engineer : Working on the design, installation, and maintenance of renewable energy systems such as solar, wind, and hydroelectric power systems. Telecommunications Engineer : Designing and optimizing telecommunications networks, including wired and wireless systems, for voice, data, and video transmission. Instrumentation Engineer : Developing and implementing systems to measure and control various parameters in industrial processes, laboratories, and research settings. Robotics Engineer : Designing, building, and programming robots for tasks ranging from manufacturing and logistics to healthcare and entertainment. Hardware Engineer : Designing and testing physical components of electronic systems, including printed circuit boards (PCBs), integrated circuits (ICs), and microprocessors. Research and Development Engineer : Conducting research and experimentation to develop new technologies, products, and processes in areas such as power electronics, semiconductor devices, and nanotechnology.

column1: Sr.Executive - Engg Material /Spare planning - Corp role-FMCG/F&B
column2: One of our leading client into F&B industry looking for a good store Management / Inventory management - in large scale, who has  exp of stores  or specific engineering stores which includes spares. Should have exp of SAP and preferably monitoring at multi - location levels  Note: We are looking for the candidate have engineering material / Spare parts planning experience at corporate level managed / managing pan India  Position - Sr. Executive Reporting to - Manager Spare  Roles and Responsibilities   Inventory (Spares) - Process improvement: Approval of POs for Spares and decide buy vs stock transfer for cost reduction Coordinate with Plants for creation of spares codes in SAP while ensuring there is no duplication Identification of duplicate codes and their deactivation in SAP Coordination with Plants to ensure duplicate codes are reduced and reasons for their creation are identified and process streamlined ABC categorization of spares to identify critical and regular spares for all Plants Definition of Minimum - Maximum - Reorder levels for all spares is done in SAP. Review monthly stock statements, inventory coverage at Plants vis a vis production plan Identify challenges faced by Plants in ordering, receiving and storage of inventory  Review of local spares procurement at Plant - quotations, comparatives, pricing, cost reduction opportunities. Single Vendor analysis - Identification of instances of single spares vendors at Plants and opportunities to reduce risk. Physical Verification and disposal - Assets and Spares: Carrying out physical verification of Assets at select Plants once in a year including update in bar coding portal (Asset Management System) Carrying out physical verification of spares at selected Plants once in a year Reconciliation and sign offs to be obtained from all stakeholders at the Plant and submission to HO Accounts. Identification and scrapping of unused / old assets and spares Coordination with Plants to ensure scrapping process is completed in a time bound manner Coordination with Plants for Asset Bar coding activity, generation of bar code stickers, and ensure timely completion of activity. Internal Order Analysis: Internal order analysis for Plants to be done on monthly basis to identify gaps in implementation Coordinate with Technical Managers at HO - Plant - SAP Admin to streamline process for internal order accounting and analysis. AMC review: Review of AMC portal for machinery and equipment covered, service reports, delays in servicing, spare parts consumed, etc. Experience - 5 - 10 Yrs  Qualification : BE / B.tech /PG diploma in Scm /MM (regular) Location - Mumbai Kindly have a look and share your update cv in word format my email Id .. vagish@ecatapult.net Regards Vagish.
